title: Fix not allow using both react 17 and 18 in the SDK
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42354

### Description

Our SDK supports both React 17 and 18 since we built our components with React 17 and React 18 is backward-compatible with React 17. This is only the package.json dependency version issue.

### How to verify

1. Create a React 18 application using:
    ```bash
    npx create-react-app my-app
    cd my-app
    ```
1. (in another shell) Build the Embedding SDK using `master` with these commands:
    ```bash
    yarn build-release:cljs && yarn build-embedding-sdk:watch
    ```
1. Go back to the React 18 application and install the SDK:
    ```bash
    # The location of the file might be different depending your folder structure
    npm install --install-links file:../metabase/resources/embedding-sdk
    ```
1. You should see an error that `react` versions are incompatible
1. (in another shell) Build the Embedding SDK using this PR with these commands:
    ```bash
    yarn build-release:cljs && yarn build-embedding-sdk:watch
    ```
1. Go back to the React 18 application and install the SDK:
    ```bash
    # The location of the file might be different depending your folder structure
    npm install --install-links file:../metabase/resources/embedding-sdk
    ```
1. You should not see any error
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Fix axios security issue by updating the upstream library version
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/security/dependabot/144

### Description

Axios was used by loki@0.33.0 which is used for visual testing. Upgrading to 0.35.0 solved the problem because it doesn't require axios anymore

### How to verify

Run `yarn audit`, and there should not be axios in the result.

title: Fix flaky question management e2e test
body:
See [Slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C5XHN8GLW/p1715242891189679).

Examples of failed runs:
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9009583063
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9009971427
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9013749033

### Description

When I run the stress test with 50 burn-in (which means 100 runs because the test is defined in a loop) it starts to flake at the end (after 80+ runs) - I suspect it's due to Cypress giving up (out of memory or something alike).
So I decided to run it 25x twice, and it looks green now.

Stress tests (this PR):
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9016541427 (25x)
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9016541785 (25x)

Stress test on `master`, for comparison: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9015446311
author: kamilmielnik

title: Combine column shortcut
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42172

This contains changes from https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/42261, review that first.

### Description

Adds the combine column shortcut.


### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Browse data -> Sample Dataset -> Accounts
2. Click the `Add column` button in the top right part of the table header
3. Click `Combine columns`
4. Enter the columns you want to combine and click `Done`
5. the column should appear and have the correct data

### Demo


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/300c8340-a698-437a-98d6-c0a9702e0529
author: romeovs

title: [docs] Serialization docs update
body:
A lot going on here, so here's the gist:
- Reorg existing docs: create sections that have general info about import and export, decoupled from a specific method
- New content: _Metabase uses Entity IDs to identify and reference Metabase items_,  _Metabase uses names to identify and reference data sources_, _How import works_, and _Other uses of serialization_

  Most of the new content is there to address how serialization is actually used by our customers. It's not the intended use case, but it's the most common one, so there's a lot of demand to have it documented. Parts of this probably will have a better home in Learn than in docs, but I wanted to get this out quicker. 
Hopefully once we productionalize templating, we'll be able to get rid of most of this stuff.


Specific feedback I'm looking for:
- Does the organization make sense? 
- Section titles
- Everything about the new content
author: alexyarosh
labels: [('Type:Documentation', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: allow using urls from other columns in link templates
body:
### Description

If a column value is a valid and safe link like "https://metabase.com" we rendered it as a clickable link. 
However, if we use our column formatting feature on another column and format it as a link with the template that fully refers to the column with urls like `{{safe_url_column}}` the link was broken. We reasonably URI encoded all the interpolated values in the template. At the same time, for the described case it does not increase security risks because we already render safe_url_column values as clickable links.

This PR makes the formatting to skip URI encoding if interpolated values:
- Safe urls with https, http, mailto protocols
- The value is coming from another column of a dataset
- The value is in the beginning of a template

### How to verify

⚠️ Verify the security assumptions above are correct.

### Column formatting
Create a question:
```sql
select 1 a, 'http://google.com' b
union all select 2, 'javascript:alert(document.cookie)'
```

Change column A formatting settings to: Link with `{{B}}` template.
Click on 1: ensure it opens google.com
Click on 2: ensure it opens http://localhost:3000/javascript%3Aalert(document.cookie) — encoded safe url

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/14301985/87923994-2131-4ecd-a4da-85d77698b27f

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Add `metabase.api` API namespace
body:
For the dynamic variables in `metabase.api.common` I wrote new helper functions so you don't have to access them directly (which  don't really work with Potemkin since they end up being two separate vars).

Also added support for `:clj-kondo` ignore forms associated with a particular `:require`. I used this so `metabase.api.middleware.session`, a "glue" namespace, can access internals of `metabase.api.common`.

Note that this PR is not a commentary on whether `metabase.api` makes sense as a module in its current shape. I think the current user stuff might belong in a different module, since stuff like the QP does sometimes need to access `current-user-id` but has no business accessing stuff like the API `routes`. We can worry about this stuff later tho.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Add `metabase.actions.core` module API namespace
body: Consolidate all external usage of the `metabase.actions` module into a new `metabase.actions.core` namespace. There was already a `metabase.actions` namespace that was used as a dependency by other namespaces in the module so for now I created a new namespace rather than turn this into a giant refactor
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

author: metamben

title: convert `SocketChannelEndpoint` to `SocketChannel`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/13771

During SSL, the getTransport method was returning a type that we didn't expect: `SocketChannelEndpoint`, and that type was unable to be cast into a `SocketChannel`. Calling `.getChannel` on the `SocketChannelEndpoint` returns a `SocketChannel`, so that is what we do.
author: escherize
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: (1/n) refactor legend components to use items prop
body: Precursor to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41988 and https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41986 ### Description Refactoring the legend component to take a single `items` prop that is an array of objects with a `key`, `name`, and `color`, instead of taking two separate arrays of `labels` and `colors`. This will make it easier to implement toggling via the legend, because we can later add additional properties to the item object, like a boolean that describes whether the series is visible or not. In general it will make the legend easier to work with, for example when we need to add a legend item for the "other" bar in that project it'll be easier to just add one object where the name and color are coupled. ### How to verify 1. Create any chart with a legend (e.g. orders count by month, product category) 2. Confirm the legend still works and behaves like normal. ### Demo ### Checklist - [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR Covered by existing tests like `12439-click-on-legend-breaks-ui.cy.spec.js`
author: EmmadUsmani
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Tweak the Model explanation banner
body:
This PR refactors the banner that appears on the Browse models page (the `ModelExplanationBanner` component) by replacing the existing code for dismissing the banner with the `useUserSetting` hook.

The previous implementation involved directly dispatching a Redux action. This has been replaced by the `useUserSetting` hook which simplifies the logic and makes the code cleaner.

Test the dismissal of the `ModelExplanationBanner` component by going to the Browse models page and dismissing the banner. It should not show up again on subsequent visits.
author: rafpaf
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Fix flaky frontend question unit test
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42410

### Description

Although this test passes reliably locally, on slower CI runners, an API request goes out before the test completes and causes the test to fail sometimes. This adds the proper API mock and even tests for the proper UI state in search.
author: iethree

title: Support basic theming in interactive data tables for embedding SDK
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42158

### Description

We want the data table to inherit the user's theming options (e.g. `brand` color), and provide a great out-of-the-box experience by default. We also want to give user more flexibility in customizing the design of their data tables, in case they need more control (e.g. non-white background).

![CleanShot 2567-05-11 at 00 21 26@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/ae505ff4-2e13-4f62-9a7d-547233d643a1)

### How to verify

- Navigate to the `kitchen-sink-data-table` branch on the demo app
- Go to the kitchen sink.
- Go to `AppProvider.tsx` and change the colors in the `colors` and `components` section:
  - Comment out the entire `components` block. It should follow the `brand` color.
  - Uncomment the `components` block. It should follow `table.cell` and `table.idColumn`
     - Cell hover color should be a lighter color of cell background if it's a dark color, and a transparent brand color if cell background is a light color.
- Start the Metabase local instance
   - Data table should remain the same in the webapp

### Caveat

- The header color cannot be customized in this PR. It will always be white, for now. We plan to add this option in later PRs.

### Demo

Without any theme configuration, it follows the `brand` color.

![CleanShot 2567-05-13 at 16 42 23@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/54c6bac6-5a74-4bc1-a692-b039fb0aa452)

With `cell.textColor`, `cell.backgroundColor` and `idColumn.backgroundColor` set

![CleanShot 2567-05-13 at 16 44 40@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/b98824fd-e6dd-4592-951f-9c84ca466c0d)

No changes to the existing interactive data table in the dashboard.

![CleanShot 2567-05-13 at 16 47 07@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/4d5e252e-45c1-4313-9acc-0fff3bee4f95)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
   - I might add more tests to verify that themes from the SDK are being applied to the table's elements, but let's do this in a separate PR as this one is getting a bit large.
author: heypoom
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Fix SDK interactive question showing no question error incorrectly
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42352

### Description

The problem happened because we only relied on `loading` which indicates whether the initial question has been loaded or not, after that there could be another loading state when users drills down.

### How to verify

1. Using Customer Zero app.
1. Go to Products > click on a product > Drills on the first bar chart. And there should be no question error state anymore.
1. Click other page on the nav bar e.g. kitchen sink.
1. Click Products again > click on a probuct and there should be no question error state.

### Demo
#### Before

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/79cd60ef-60d2-471d-aeac-f0ede2e3299d


#### After
https://www.loom.com/share/65437958d8ff461796e73de630a763b6

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Design update for extract examples
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42375 ### Description Render the examples for Extract Column inline instead of underneath the title. ### How to verify Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected. 1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> Custom Column 2. Select `Extract column` 3. Select a column 4. Verify that the examples render inline, not underneath the titles ### Demo ### Notes I updated the horizontal `ClickActionsControl` to use `Button` from `metabase/ui` for this, instead of the deprecated `Button`. I can convert the rest to use CSS modules too if that is preferred.

No image for now, as the palette is still baking.

Also added some notes on search.

title: Fix overflow problem in Filter Modal sidebar
body: ### Description Filter modal has a broken layout when many columns from joins are available on the left sidebar. ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/890f53ca-0d57-4cea-b62f-72ba41eb0bf3) ### How to verify - Create a question with several joins, save it - go to the question, open filter modal - verify that left sidebar has more elements than rendered on the screen and there is scroll bar ### Demo ### Checklist - [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Quartz: auto delete jobs without a class during scheduler initialization
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36184

Whenever we delete a Quartz Job we have to write a custom migration to delete it, see `DeleteTruncateAuditLogTask` for example. 

This makes it so on initialization of task scheduler, we will automatically delete any jobs that can't find a class.

I don't know how to write a test that involves making a class disappear, but any ideas are welcome!

But here is how I manually tested it.
1. Start MB normally
2. Comment out the `(delete-jobs-with-no-class!)` call in `init-scheduler!`
3. Comment out all the code in `metabase.task.follow-up-emails` to make the `FollowUpEmail` disappear
4. Restart MB, eval `(metabase.task/scheduler-info)` in the reply will print out an exception saying `FollowUpEmail` not found
5. Uncomment `(delete-jobs-with-no-class!)` in step 2, and restart MB
6. Eval `(metabase.task/scheduler-info)`, this time there should be no errors because the `metabase.task.follow-up-emails.job` has been deleted.


This will also prevent us from having situations like this: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41772#issuecomment-2100263983
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 8, 11, 23, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2102435329, 'issue_id': 2285332678, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': "+1 to Cal's idea for a test. That's much simpler than trying to fiddle with class loaders, which I'm not sure is even possible.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 9, 10, 54, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2102437983, 'issue_id': 2285332678, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': "I'm a bit conflicted on this change. While I understand the ergonomics, I dislike the asymmetry between how we add the triggers and remove them. I also dislike that if we changed our mind and brought back the class it would be non-deterministic whether it's removed depending on how many versions the customer is upgrading. I'd lean towards making it more convenient to do the clean-up versus making it completely automatic. For example we could have a migration helper that just takes a list of the classes, and have our dev environments fail start-up if they find a stale trigger, so we remember to add this migration. Update: just read about the issue with the rollback / roll-forward bug, I guess this is the lesser of two evils. If we could have this only trigger on rollbacks, e.g. by tracking in which version a trigger was added, or by handling it in the rollback migration itself, that seems cleaner though.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 9, 10, 56, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2102494629, 'issue_id': 2285332678, 'author': 'piranha', 'body': "> I also dislike that if we changed our mind and brought back the class it would be non-deterministic whether it's removed depending on how many versions the customer is upgrading. On the other hand, all of our jobs have their triggers/schedules configured all the time and it feels like it should not be a problem? If it does not exist, it'll add itself? So the opposite is - if it does not exist, it should be removed?", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 9, 11, 36, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2102525195, 'issue_id': 2285332678, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': "> If it does not exist, it'll add itself? I think I'm missing something, let's clarify in Slack 😄", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 9, 11, 58, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2102590063, 'issue_id': 2285332678, 'author': 'qnkhuat', 'body': "Thanks for chiming in! My reasoning is that if a trigger doesn't have a class, it's no use. The fact that if a trigger fails, it'll not be re-triggered means that even when we want to bring back the job class, we will still have to reschedule it anyway. Another benefit of this is that, as developers, we don't have to worry about some customers having a trigger of the same class we deleted two cycles ago. That'd be a big surprise for anyone, IMO. I think this is a bit of WYSIWYG, in the sense that all the jobs that could be happening are the jobs that we have in code.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 9, 12, 43, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2106707927, 'issue_id': 2285332678, 'author': 'qnkhuat', 'body': '@crisptrutski @calherries added a test', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 13, 5, 53, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

crisptrutski on (2024-05-09 10:54:32 UTC): +1 to Cal's idea for a test. That's much simpler than trying to fiddle with class loaders, which I'm not sure is even possible. crisptrutski on (2024-05-09 10:56:23 UTC): I'm a bit conflicted on this change. While I understand the ergonomics, I dislike the asymmetry between how we add the triggers and remove them. I also dislike that if we changed our mind and brought back the class it would be non-deterministic whether it's removed depending on how many versions the customer is upgrading. I'd lean towards making it more convenient to do the clean-up versus making it completely automatic. For example we could have a migration helper that just takes a list of the classes, and have our dev environments fail start-up if they find a stale trigger, so we remember to add this migration. Update: just read about the issue with the rollback / roll-forward bug, I guess this is the lesser of two evils. If we could have this only trigger on rollbacks, e.g. by tracking in which version a trigger was added, or by handling it in the rollback migration itself, that seems cleaner though. piranha on (2024-05-09 11:36:03 UTC): On the other hand, all of our jobs have their triggers/schedules configured all the time and it feels like it should not be a problem? If it does not exist, it'll add itself? So the opposite is - if it does not exist, it should be removed? crisptrutski on (2024-05-09 11:58:24 UTC): I think I'm missing something, let's clarify in Slack 😄 qnkhuat (Issue Creator) on (2024-05-09 12:43:16 UTC): Thanks for chiming in! My reasoning is that if a trigger doesn't have a class, it's no use. The fact that if a trigger fails, it'll not be re-triggered means that even when we want to bring back the job class, we will still have to reschedule it anyway. Another benefit of this is that, as developers, we don't have to worry about some customers having a trigger of the same class we deleted two cycles ago. That'd be a big surprise for anyone, IMO. I think this is a bit of WYSIWYG, in the sense that all the jobs that could be happening are the jobs that we have in code. qnkhuat (Issue Creator) on (2024-05-13 05:53:17 UTC): @crisptrutski @calherries added a test

title: Simplify custom font code
body:
This is a follow-up PR from #42342. I already [asked on Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C505ZNNH4/p1715098187144839) that this should be possible.

#### How to verify

Test that the custom font is still working.
1. Go to Admin settings > Appearance > Font: Custom > Set custom font e.g. `https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/poetsenone/v3/ke8hOgIaMUB37xCgvCntWuIoofOzEqG8.woff2`
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/705feaad-8fed-4347-b618-43488157bc3d)

The custom font and other fonts should still work.

title: Fix failed to upgrade when instances have obsolete 3rd party drivers
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42319

Users will fail to upgrade if they have a database connected to 3rd party drivers and run an obsolete version. This is because in our `DeleteScanFieldValuesTriggerForDBThatTurnItOff` migration, we use toucan2 to find metabase by using toucan2 models `:model/Database`, this model has an after-select hook that try to initialize that driver. 

And if users have an obsolete driver => initialize, failed => migration failed => fail to upgrade.

Even though those databases are unusable, we shouldn't block users from upgrading.

How to test:
- Download clickhouse driver version 1.2.3 : https://github.com/ClickHouse/metabase-clickhouse-driver/releases/tag/1.2.3 
- Starts metabase version 47(which is compatible with clickhouse v 1.2.3) and add a click house db
- Stop the instance and upgrade to 49.8, and you'll see the failure.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Add metric icons in the notebook editor
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42356 Adds metric icons in Data and Join steps if the card is a metric. How to verify: - New -> Question -> Select metric - Join a metric - See that there are new icons - For regular tables/questions should should be no icons Please note that `Orders` is displayed incorrectly here because of a MBQL lib bug https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42390.

title: bump methodical
body:
now:

```clojure
❯ clj -M:"$ALIASES"
Warning: environ value /Users/dan/.sdkman/candidates/java/current for key :java-home has been overwritten with /Users/dan/.sdkman/candidates/java/21.0.2-tem
2024-05-07 19:55:25,167 INFO metabase.util :: Maximum memory available to JVM: 8.0 GB
```

no logs about recur targets unboxing

related:
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/42311
- https://github.com/camsaul/methodical/pull/147 (these changes are what this version bump brings in)

title: Allow drivers to not automatically add a PK column for CSV uploads
body:
This PR adds a new driver feature: `upload-with-auto-pk`. 

If the feature is supported, an auto-incrementing `_mb_row_id` column is added to a table when it is created or updated with a CSV upload. If the feature is not supported, the `_mb_row_id` column is not added. By default the value of the feature is true, since that preserves existing behaviour for existing CSV upload drivers.

The PR targets the 49 branch and will be forward-ported to master rather than the other way around, because I'm developing this with the clickhouse driver in mind, which currently only works with 49.

title: Allow disabling health check logging via env var
body:
Pursuant to title, adds a `MB_HEALTH_CHECK_LOGGING_ENABLED` env var which can be set to `false` to omit these logs. Env var name & boolean direction is arbitrary, can change it if requested.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/35338

title: Migrate smart scalar and night mode to support Mantine theming
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42159

### Description

This PR migrates the smart scalar component that was written in Emotion to use Mantine components [per the RFC](https://www.notion.so/metabase/94-Migrate-a-subset-of-Emotion-components-to-Mantine-to-support-theming-in-React-embedding-SDK-ebf1c71def0745eaa07678c6da31403f), so we can apply theming values accordingly.

### How to verify

First, verify that the migration works as expected.
- Checkout the master branch in the main repo. Open a question and a dashboard. Open the static embedding preview, and change the theme to night. Capture a screenshot.
- Checkout this branch. Do the same as above. Compare the results - they must be the same.

Next, verify that the Mantine theme applies.
- Checkout the `basic-theming-smart-scalar` branch in the demo app.
- Go to `AppProvider.tsx`. Verify that the `text-medium` is set to `white`. You can change `white` to other color for easy verification.
- The color of the smart scalar's description should now follow this PR.

### Demo

Verify that the night-mode embedding should be exactly the same for this branch as `master`.

![CleanShot 2567-05-09 at 19 35 52@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/e391d650-b808-48de-a8ce-544da4785fc3)

Verify that the demo app's text color changes.

![CleanShot 2567-05-08 at 19 24 22@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/94c94a2c-ac92-4dd8-89a1-c8b9270d66b8)

title: Serialize trash correctly
body:
Two major changes here.

First, don't set the trash ID to a constant 13371339. Instead, just add it like a normal collection (in a migration), with an appropriate `type`, and cache that so we're not constantly fetching the ID when needed.

Second, serialize the Trash correctly. If we're serializing a set of collections, serialize any items that were _trashed from_ one of those collections, as well as items that are still in the collection. However, hardcode the `descendants` of the Trash collection itself to the empty set. This way, even though we're serializing the Trash, we won't cascade down and serialize all of its descendants - just those that are being otherwise included in the export.

Fixes #42301
author: johnswanson
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Support custom font in SDK
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42214

### Description

This supports using Custom Metabase font. Although, the instance needs to be set as `Custom` too for now.

It seems we can't override the font to something else that's not the instance font. That should be addressed in #42341

### How to verify

1. Build this SDK, and set the Font family to `Custom`
1. Go to your Metabase > Admin settings > Appearance > Font > Choose `Custom` at the bottom.
1. Put the link to your font in one or more font styles. You can grab the font link from Google Font.

### Demo

Try setting your instance font to `Custom` first.

#### Before
![Screenshot 2024-05-07 at 7 22 08 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/1d61348e-8764-403b-b5b2-22750ab8cad3)

#### After

Tested using `https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/poetsenone/v3/ke8hOgIaMUB37xCgvCntWuIoofOzEqG8.woff2`
![Screenshot 2024-05-07 at 10 56 58 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/4563c149-d237-4a11-96ee-adc6eac932cf)


### Checklist

- [ ] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~

title: Update the README to document some SDK quirks
body:
This was reported in [this Slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C06FCQT0KMZ/p1715071604804019), and [this thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C06FCQT0KMZ/p1715074631457679)

This PR does:
1. Update the syntax to use `require` instead of `import`, so users don't have to use any transpiler, or use module mode which isn't on by default.
1. Document additional CORS setting that are needed, if users deploy FE and BE on separate domains.
1. Correct Metabase SSO auth endpoint
1. Modify npm install command to suppress the error when install the SDK on a project that uses React 18
1. Add divs with some styles necessary for question visualization to show up, otherwise, they will have 0px height.

title: Prioritize sending fast pulses
body:
Last one on milestone 1 of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41764.

This makes it so that each pulse trigger will set its own priority with the value being the invert of its duration round to the second.

We need to invert because quartz executes high priorities triggers first. ([ref](https://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.3.0/tutorials/tutorial-lesson-04.html))

title: Use `DataPicker` in `JoinTablePicker`
body:
Closes #40952

### How to verify

1. Create a new question and choose data source
2. Try to join something to it
    - the selection of questions/tables/models should be limited to the database of data source selected in step 1
    - the database selection step in "Tables" tab should not be visible
    - "Models" and "Saved questions" tabs should not be visible if data source database does not have any models or questions respectively

Note: changing data source of a question to a one from a different database should remove the no-longer-valid join clause, but it does not work - I reported it separately: #42385

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/6830683/00a1098d-2815-42eb-a82e-352505828227

title: attempt to type the return value of actions created by createThunkAction
body:
## Description

This is an attempt to make `createThunkAction` return thunks with a return type.

I initially thought this was not worth doing, but we're using `createThunkAction` in a lot of places and it basically acts as a black hole for types. Typing things manually would probably take more time and would be more error prone.

I left many inline comments in the PR to explain some gotchas and our reasoning.

Note:
I'll soon open an RFC to propose the deprecation of `createThunkAction`, I think having two ways to create thunks (`createThunkAction` and `createAsyncAction` from rtk) will cause many unnecessary headaches as they have very similar names, very similar goals but different implementations with some gotchas.
With that said, we'll most likely have some `createThunkAction` arounds for a while so some typing will help us

title: Option to customize base font size in React embedding
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42321 ### Description Mantine does not provide an option to change the base font size. Rather, it exposes the `fontSizes` object which requires each individual font sizes (e.g. xs, sm, md, lg, xl) to be set independently - this would be confusing to SDK users if we expose those. Instead, we expose a single `fontSize` property in the theme object. We then apply the base font size to the SDK content wrapper. ### Caveat - Even though the base font size is applied to the SDK container, certain elements still has a fixed pixel size (i.e. chart label is 12px, scalar value title) so they won't be affected. We should address them in their specific PRs, e.g. themeable scalar value PR. ### How to verify - Go to the `main` branch in the demo app - Change the `fontSize` theme property, e.g. to "18px" - Remove every CSS from `product-list.css` and `product-detail.css`, as they are workarounds that shouldn't be necessary. - The font size of the embedded components should change accordingly: Filter Panel, Popover, Scalar Value Comparison, etc. ### Demo Using `fontSize: "1.18rem"`. Note that scalar value here is not affected as it is fixed. ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: heypoom

title: Do not require `onConfirm` prop in `EntityPickerModal`
body:
Closes #41172

### Description

`EntityPickerModal` required `onConfirm` prop to be present despite it not being used when `options.hasConfirmButtons` was `false`. We had to awkwardly pass `onConfirm={_.noop}` to work around it.

This PR makes `onConfirm` prop optional and adds a runtime assertion that this prop needs to be present when `options.hasConfirmButtons` is `true`.
I chose runtime assertion (KISS) over conditional TS types which are already quite complex in this component.

### How to verify

The new unit test passes.

(lots of other tests are expected to fail though)

title: An one time job to init send-pulse trigger and migration down to clean up send-pulse triggers
body:
A follow-up of #41772.

In that PR we have a method we called `update-send-pulse-trigger-if-needed!` as part of `task/init!` for `SendPulses` jobs.

It was meant to be a migration to create `SendPulse` triggers for existing triggers that don't have one.

It's ideally only run once, so this PR puts it into a job that is only triggered once. Inspired by the BackfillQueryField job from @piranha ([see](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/42279#discussion_r1591920071))

This also adds 2 migrations that run only on downgrade to remove the SendPulse job and InitSendPulseTriggers. We need so this to avoid the problem Cal described [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41772#issuecomment-2100263983). 

By having these 2 migrations, if user downgrade, then upgrade, InitSendPulseTriggers will be triggered again and all sendpulse job will be correctly scheduled.

This PR also includes a typo fix for `DeleteSendPulsesTask` migration.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Allow duplicate "combine column" columns in chill mode
body:
### Description

This PR fixes an issue where selecting the same settings in the combine columns drill thru wasn't working.


### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Browse data -> Accounts
2. Click the `First name` header and select combine columns
3. Click `Done`
4. Click the `First name` header again and select combine columns again
5. Click `Done`
6. You should now have two extra columns: `First name ID` and `First name ID_2`


### Demo

title: Snowflake: fix sync dynamic table
body:
The `sync-dynamic-tables-test` started failing a couple of days out of nowhere. There is not much recent work on Snowflake. In fact, the test even fails on old commits where it was passing before.

Context: https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C5XHN8GLW/p1714641978456929

So the only explanation I can give is that Snowflake changed their internal interpretation of the `:type` column returned by `.getTables` method since for dynamic tables we're getting back `TABLE` type, it was `DYNAMIC_TABLE` before.

I can't find any PRs over https://github.com/snowflakedb/snowflake-jdbc that can introduce this. Even querying from `INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES` no longer returns "DYNAMIC_TABLE" as a type.

```sql
SELECT * FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES WHERE table_name = 'dynamic_table_name';
```

So too make this check, I used the `SHOW DYNAMIC TABLES` command to search for the table to see if it exists. There is another way which is to use `SHOW TABLES` command and check for the `is_dyanmic` column. But since this column is not [documented](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/show-tables#output), we should avoid them for now.
author: qnkhuat

title: Silence `abs` warning on startup
body:
before:

```clojure
❯ clj -M:"$ALIASES"
Warning: environ value /Users/dan/.sdkman/candidates/java/current for key :java-home has been overwritten with /Users/dan/.sdkman/candidates/java/21.0.2-tem
WARNING: abs already refers to: #'clojure.core/abs in namespace: clojure.algo.generic.math-functions, being replaced by: #'clojure.algo.generic.math-functions/abs
2024-05-07 04:39:37,890 INFO metabase.util :: Maximum memory available to JVM: 8.0 GB
```

after:

```clojure
❯ clj -M:"$ALIASES"
Warning: environ value /Users/dan/.sdkman/candidates/java/current for key :java-home has been overwritten with /Users/dan/.sdkman/candidates/java/21.0.2-tem
2024-05-07 04:40:42,561 INFO metabase.util :: Maximum memory available to JVM: 8.0 GB
```

Now no warning about `abs`
author: dpsutton

title: Don't optimize temporal filters with unbucketed exprs against relative datetimes
body:
Fixes #42291

```clj
[:between <some-expr-with :default bucketing> [:relative-datetime -16 :week] [:relative-datetime -15 :week]]
```

was incorrectly getting optimized to

```clj
[:and 
 [:>= <some-expr-with :default bucketing> [:relative-datetime -16 :week]]
 [:< <some-expr-with :default bucketing> [:relative-datetime -15 :week]]
```

which isn't quite correct.

Disable filter optimization for in situations like these where we can't generate something sane.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

body:
Convert `nest-query` query transformation logic to MLv2

This is a simplified version of PR #40988

The logic here is simpler and easier to follow/test compared to the old stuff, and has the added benefit of not including columns in the new first stage that we don't end up using in the new second stage, as you can see in the test changes

Fixes #42205

title: New Recents + Popular API Format - Frontend
body:
> [!Note]
> The frontend code here is ready for review, but there is one little piece missing in the backend: models should return with `model: dataset`, but currently they have `model: card`


> [!Important]
> I highly recommend looking at this PR by commit, rather than all at once. The first few commits have all the substance, and the bulk of the PR is just cleaning up types and test mocks

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41957

### Description

Uses a better, beefier recents format from the backend, and handles a larger number of recent items.

Recents appear in:

. | .
--|--
Homepage | ![Screen Shot 2024-05-07 at 4 49 01 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/f8315636-39d7-49d4-ac5b-8b59542660ae)
Search Results | ![Screen Shot 2024-05-07 at 4 48 55 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/89989837-7f01-48cd-84a9-7d9dd9793c47)

Popular items only appear on the home page for brand new users. 

![Screen Shot 2024-05-07 at 3 58 20 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/59de16e3-f9ea-4a4b-97fc-b0876179e4dd)

To test this component, i'd recommend just modifying the if statement in `HomeContent.tsx` like so:

![Screen Shot 2024-05-07 at 4 52 09 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/ac504cec-0c7a-44c1-a2dd-a402f298cdef)




### Checklist

title: Only nest expressions referenced in breakouts or aggregations
body:
Previously when compiling MBQL queries to SQL, if any stage had `:expressions`, we would move them into their own additional new stage.

The main reason for this was to avoid fussy databases being fussy with queries like

```sql
SELECT 
  concat(my_field, ?)
FROM
  my_table
GROUP BY
  concat(my_field, ?)
ORDER BY
  concat(my_field, ?) ASC
```

instead the `nest-expressions` stuff would let us generate SQL like

```sql
SELECT 
  source.expr
FROM (
  SELECT 
    concat(my_field, ?) AS expr   
  FROM
    my_table
) source
GROUP BY
  source.expr
ORDER BY
  source.expr ASC
```

This was a little problematic however since the new `Offset()` as a custom column breaks when the expressions get moved to a different stage than the order by (since it needs to look at the order by in for the `OVER ()` statement).

This PR updates the `nest-expressions` middleware to only nest expressions if they are used by breakouts or aggregations in that stage. So a query like the example above would still get nested, but simple queries that just add additional Fields do not get nested.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Fix tooltip shows data for different X value
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42243 ### Description Fixes tooltip shows data for different x-value. The dataset normalization for normalized stacked charts lost the original datum index. ### How to verify Verify the reported question: - Download CSV results from https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C01LQQ2UW03/p1714764194303799 - Upload to your instance - When you hover the last bar it shows the correct tooltip #### A simpler example Create a stacked bar chart from the query ```sql select DATE '2020-01-01' x, 10 y1, 20 y2 union all select null, null, null union all select DATE '2020-02-01', 10, 20 ``` When hovering the second bar ensure the tooltip shows correct values ### Demo Before After ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix x-axis time series interval computation when x-values include nulls
body: ### Description On time series charts when x-axis column contains null values the time series interval is not computed correctly. ### How to verify ```sql select DATE '2020-01-01' x, 10 y union all select null, 10 union all select DATE '2020-03-01', 10 ``` Before the fix, the x-axis interval was computed as 1 ms instead of 1 month. ### Demo Before After ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix mysql with multiple most recent revision
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41374.

Some Metabase instances run on MySQL have `revision.timestamp` rounded to the second (I'm not sure why 🫣), which makes our migration set `most_recent=true` for more than one revision that was created at the same time second. 

The previous SQL to update `revision.most_recent` didn't consider this and updated to use `row_number` to rank the latest revision.

The fix is to add a new migration for 49 that sets `most_recent = true` to the latest revision and `false` to older ones. We add this to 49 because several migrations touch `revision.most_recent` in 49, and it's risky for us to backport a migration to an old version patch since order execution can mess things up. Also to reduce that risk, this fixes for only MySQL since postgres and h2 shouldn't have this issue.

For users running 48, we can ask them nicely to run the manual query.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix collection data for trashed items
body: When something is in the trash, we need to check permissions on the `trashed_from_collection_id` rather than the `collection_id`. We were doing this. However, we want the actual collection data on the search result to represent the actual collection it's in (the trash). I added the code to do this, a test to make sure it works as intended, and a comment to explain what we're doing here and why.

title: adds diagnostic info to troubleshooting for air gapping
body:
After a meeting with the success team, they mentioned that it'd be nice to have more info about the currently running metabase instance.

Iff airgap mode is setup we return these, otherwise it's elided:

- [x] that the airgap token is enabled
- [x] what the max users cap is
- [x] what the current user count is
- [x] when the expiration date is
